hints.content:
When **multiplying** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **left**.

When **dividing** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **right**.

Each digit of $3{,}400$ is one place to the right of the same digits in the number $34{,}000$.

Ten thousands | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones
:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |:-:
$\searrow\goldD3$ | $\searrow\purpleD4$ | $\searrow\blueC0$ | $\searrow\greenD0$ |$\cancel0$
 | $\goldD3$ | $\purpleD4$ | $\blueC0$ | $\greenD0$


Moving each digit of $34{,}000$ to the right means dividing by $10$:

$\goldD3\purpleD4{,}\blueD0\greenD00 \div 10 = \goldD3{,}\purpleD4\blueD0\greenD0$ so,

$\goldD3\purpleD4{,}\blueD0\greenD00 \div \goldD3{,}\purpleD4\blueD0\greenD0 = 10$

question.content:
**Complete the equation with a $\times$ or $\div$ sign.**
  

$34{,}000$ [[☃ dropdown 1]] $3{,}400=10$
